title: Tom Clark Seeks Fourth Term as Justice of Peace Precinct 1
summary: Justice of Peace Tom Clark, a third-generation Comal County resident who was born and raised in New Braunfels, is seeking his fourth term representing Precinct 1. Early voting begins February 17 with election day March 3.

title: Michael French Draws 45 to First Mayoral Town Hall
summary: Mayoral candidate Michael French held his first campaign town hall at Cooper's Pit Bar-B-Que, drawing 45 residents for Q&A. French is one of 5 filed candidates with early voting starting Feb 17.

title: Deb Hindman Drops Out of Comal County Judge Race
summary: Deb Hindman has withdrawn from the Republican primary for Comal County Judge, narrowing the race to Kristen Hoyt and Kayne Parrish. Her husband announced the decision at a packed community meeting about the Lennar development and TCEQ concerns at Canyon Lake High School. Hindman will remain on the March 3 ballot but is not running.

title: Christi Craddick Campaigns for Texas Comptroller in Republican Primary
summary: Current Railroad Commissioner Christi Craddick is running for Texas Comptroller, with campaign mailers reaching Comal County voters. Her messaging focuses on protecting taxpayer dollars, auditing every division and program, and fiscal accountability. Early voting Feb 17-27, election day March 3.

title: Comal County Clerk Race: Four Republicans Compete in March 3 Primary
summary: Four Republican candidates are vying for the open Comal County Clerk seat being vacated by Bobbie Koepp: Ryan Bourbon-Stuart, Garrison Maurer, LeAnn Miller, and Romelle 'Melle' Walkup. Miller's campaign mailer emphasizes fiscal responsibility, cutting budgets, protecting taxpayer dollars, and streamlining government. Early voting begins Feb 17.

title: Former MLB Star Mark Teixeira Campaigns for TX-21 Congressional Seat
summary: Former New York Yankees first baseman Mark 'Tex' Teixeira is running to succeed Rep. Chip Roy in Texas Congressional District 21, which includes Comal County. His campaign mailer emphasizes border security, defending life and 2nd Amendment rights, banning men from women's sports, and standing with President Trump. Teixeira has been called a frontrunner in the crowded GOP primary, though critics say he's buying the seat.

title: Commissioners Court to Discuss Interim County Judge Appointment Feb 26
summary: Comal County commissioners are expected to discuss appointing an interim county judge during their Feb 26 meeting, following Judge Sherman Krause's death on February 7.

title: New Braunfels Chamber Hosts Pre-Primary Candidate Forum
summary: The New Braunfels Chamber of Commerce hosted a candidate forum featuring Republican candidates from both Comal and Guadalupe counties, including the three candidates vying for Comal County Judge.

title: New Braunfels Software Engineer Paul Rojas Runs for US House District 21
summary: Paul Rojas, a cybersecurity expert and software engineer from New Braunfels, is running in the Republican primary for US House District 21 to replace Chip Roy. The Austin American-Statesman editorial board highlighted his expertise on AI's effects on Texas jobs, land, and water.

title: Comal County Commissioner Crownover Elevated to Vice President Role at Texas Association of Counties
summary: Precinct 4 Commissioner Jen Crownover was sworn in as vice president of the Texas Association of Counties Board of Directors, representing counties across the state in a key leadership role.

title: Comal County Judge Candidates Profile Available
summary: Candidate profile for Comal County Judge race includes Parrish, who cites Christian values and politics in the Bible as motivation for running. Position became vacant after Judge Sherman Krause's death.

title: Comal County Commissioner Precinct 2 Candidates Announced
summary: Early voting begins February 17 for the Comal County Commissioner Precinct 2 race featuring candidates John Stratemann, Steve Minus, and Steven Rollins. Election day is March 3, 2026.

title: County Judge Seat Vacant After Passing of Sherman Krause
summary: Comal County Judge Sherman Krause passed away on February 7, 2026, leaving the county's top administrative position vacant. Commissioners Court will need to appoint a replacement or call a special election.

title: Five Candidates File for New Braunfels Mayor
summary: The New Braunfels mayoral race is shaping up with five candidates: incumbent Neal Linnartz, Michael French, Bradley Porter, Angela Allen, and Jonathon Frazier. Filing deadline is February 13, 2026.

title: Rep. Carrie Isaac Files Transportation Infrastructure Bill
summary: State Representative Carrie Isaac (R-District 73) filed a bill aimed at improving transportation infrastructure in the I-35 corridor through Comal County, citing rapid population growth as the driving factor.
